metadata.title: CVE-2013-2200 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
WordPress before 3.5.2 does not properly check the capabilities of roles,which allows remote authenticated users to bypass intended restrictions onpublishing and authorship reassignment via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.5.2+dfsg-1').
